1: O God, I need you very much as a deer needs to drink water from a cool stream.\q1
2:
I desire to be with you, the all-powerful God.\q2 I say to myself, "When will I be able to go back to the temple in Israel
\q2 and worship in your presence again?"


\q1
3:
Every day and every night I weep;\q2 the only thing I have to drink is my tears;
\q1 and while I do that, my enemies are always asking me,
\q2 "Why does your God not help you?"
\q1
5:
So now I say to myself, "Why am I in a panic?\q1 I confidently expect God to bless me,
\q2 and again I will praise him,
\q2 my God, the one who saves me."
\q1
6:
But now, Yahweh, I was panicking,\q2 so I think about you.
\q1 You are there in Israel where the Jordan River rushes down from the bottom of the peaks of Mount Hermon and from Mount Mizar.


\q1
7:
But here, the great sorrow that I feel is like water that you send down;\q2 it is like a waterfall that tumbles down and floods over me.
\q1
8:
I desire that Yahweh will show me each day that he faithfully loves me,\q2 in order that each night I may sing to him
\q2 and pray to him, the God who causes me to live.



\q1
9:
I say to God, who is like a huge rock on top of which I am safe,\q1 "Why have you forgotten me? You know the hardships that my enemies bring on me."
\q1
10:
They are always making fun of me;\q2 they keep asking, "Why does your God not help you?"
\q1 When they insult me like that,
\q2 it is like wounds that shatter my bones.



\q1
11:
But I say to myself,\q2 "Why am I in a panic?
\q1 I will confidently expect God to bless me,
\q2 and I will praise him again,
\q2 my God, the one who saves me."
